Interface DbgControls

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CafeWall, DrawingFactory, DrawingFrame, EquestriaMap, MapCanvas, MazeCanvas

    public interface DbgControls

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void breakJump()
      There are four modes in which the program can execute: "step": when program starts or after resuming execution by pressing '1'.

    • Method Detail

      • breakStep

        void breakStep()
        throws InterruptedException
        There are four modes in which the program can execute:
        • "step": when program starts or after resuming execution by pressing '1'.
        • "leap": when resuming execution by pressing '2'
        • "jump": when resuming execution by pressing '3'
        • "run": when resuming execution by pressing <space>.
        In "step" mode this method pauses the execution. It does nothing in any other modes.
        If paused, user can resume by pressing '1', '2', '3' or < space > to continue the execution in the corresponding mode.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        See Also:
        breakStep(long), breakLeap(), breakJump()

      • breakStep

        void breakStep(long delay)
        throws InterruptedException
        There are four modes in which the program can execute:
        • "step": when program starts or after resuming execution by pressing '1'.
        • "leap": when resuming execution by pressing '2'
        • "jump": when resuming execution by pressing '3'
        • "run": when resuming execution by pressing <space>.
        In "step" mode, this method delays execution for the given number of milliseconds. It does nothing in any other mode.
        If paused, user can resume by pressing '1', '2', '3' or < space > to continue the execution in the corresponding mode.
        Parameters:
        delay - - milliseconds to delay execution in "continuous" mode.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        See Also:
        breakStep(), breakLeap(), breakJump()

      • breakLeap

        void breakLeap()
        throws InterruptedException
        There are four modes in which the program can execute:
        • "step": when program starts or after resuming execution by pressing '1'.
        • "leap": when resuming execution by pressing '2'
        • "jump": when resuming execution by pressing '3'
        • "run": when resuming execution by pressing <space>.
        In "step" or "leap" modes, this method pauses the execution until resumed. It does nothing in "jump" or "run" mode.
        If paused, user can resume by pressing '1', '2', '3' or < space > to continue the execution in the corresponding mode.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        See Also:
        breakStep(), breakStep(long), breakJump()

      • breakJump

        void breakJump()
        throws InterruptedException
        There are four modes in which the program can execute:
        • "step": when program starts or after resuming execution by pressing '1'.
        • "leap": when resuming execution by pressing '2'
        • "jump": when resuming execution by pressing '3'
        • "run": when resuming execution by pressing <space>.
        In "step", "leap" or "jump" modes, this method pauses the execution until resumed. It does nothing in "run" mode.
        If paused, user can resume by pressing '1', '2', '3' or < space > to continue the execution in the corresponding mode.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        See Also:
        breakStep(), breakStep(long), breakLeap()
